messages.content: Yes, I am familiar with Magic the Gathering, a popular collectible card game. It involves playing with cards featuring various creatures, spells, and abilities, and involves strategy, teamwork, and luck.
What is the different between a sorcery and an instant?

Sorceries are cards in Magic: The Gathering that have the ability to cast a spell. Instant cards are cards that can be played immediately after they are drafted or received. While sorceries can be powerful and versatile, instant cards are generally more focused and useful in specific situations.
What happens if I cast a Lightning Bolt targeting a Llanowar Elves?

If you cast a Lightning Bolt targeting a Llanowar Elves in a multiplayer game of Magic: The Gathering, the spell will resolve and deal 3 damage to the creature. However, the creature will not be removed from the game immediately. Instead, it will remain on the battlefield and be able to continue playing until the end of the turn. This means that the Llanowar Elves will be able to use its abilities and move around the battlefield during the turn after the Lightning Bolt is cast. Additionally, if the creature has any loyalty abilities, they will still be applied after the damage is dealt.
